The kernel uses shared memory tiling to reduce global memory access.
The kernel uses loop unrolling via pragma directives and template parameters to reduce loop overhead.
The kernel employs memory coalescing through tiling and thread block structure to optimize global memory access patterns.
The kernel uses specialized variants via compile-time constants for kernel parameters to enable compiler optimizations.
The kernel uses __restrict__ qualifiers on pointers to enable compiler optimizations by preventing pointer aliasing.
The kernel configures grid and block dimensions to align with data structure dimensions for improved locality and parallelism.
The kernel uses thread block sizes that are multiples of warp size (32).
